page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is situated in the N.Cotswolds.The landscape consists of gently undulating hills;the highest point is approximately 800ft. above sea level.The land is fairly intensively farmed & cereal & fruit growing predominate.Settlements are dispersed although there are the villages of Longborough & Donnington.Dwellings are mainly of Cotswold Stone & it is an area of rising house prices as it becomes increasingly popular as a retirement haven.Longborough is an attractive village & possesses a school, post office, church & pub.Donnington is equally attractive but considerably smaller & is largely dependent upon Broadwell nearby as it has no services of its own.Dry Cotswold stone walls are a feature of the landscape.
